item.title: Beogram 4000: A Fun Evening with a Prematurely Activating Solenoid
item.description: The Beogram 4000 restoration is progressing well. Rebuilding the deck led to a successful initial power-up where the carriage moved to the correct position, but the arm wouldn’t lower. A visual inspection showed a disconnected thin grey wire from the SK3054 NPN power transistor (0TR4). Tracing the wiring and consulting the schematic revealed that the grey wire connected to the transistor’s emitter, responsible for bypassing a current-limiting resistor (7R1) during the arm’s initial descent.

item.title: Brief Lab introduces new online certification program
item.description: The Brief Lab, an organization that trains professionals to be concise communicators, is marking its one-year anniversary with a redesigned website and the introduction of its first online certification program, Brief Practitioner. Source: The Brief Lab website. The Brief Practitioner program is geared towards professionals who want to embrace conciseness and become certified in a structured approach to lean communication. The online course is designed for those who aim to champion these methodologies within their organizations.
